creditline: Gift of funds from the N. Bud and Beverly Grossman Foundation in honor of Dr. Evan M. Maurer, Director Emeritus, for his visionary leadership of The Minneapolis Institute of Arts, 1988-2005
description: wood handle carved with repeating cone shapes above handle; two switches of braided hide attached above handle with red and green cloth
medium: Wood, animal hide, cloth, brass tack
text: Men created riding quirts, and they were used to make a horse go faster, as well as a weapon during battle.  The zig-zag design of the quirt may reference the jagged edges of lightening.  Many tribes reference this importance force in their artworks, which pay respect to the natural world around them.
title: Riding Quirt
